p: After 24 h exposure with CZEO (8.00 mg.mL –1), the growth of bacteria had a substantial difference from each other (see Fig. 5). For instance, the observed growth for S. aureus was around 15%, while this amount for K. pneumoniae was 71%. This value for the other bacteria falls between those values ( P. aeruginosa: 53% and E. coli: 40%). Antibacterial effect (MIC mg.mL –1) of CZEO on such bacteria, i.e., E. coli (1.6), K. pneumoniae (3.2), P. aeruginosa (0.8), and S. aureus (3.2) was reported previously ( 22).
